scenarioDescription:
The HD 80869 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 80869 is a star with 1.08 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.06 times its radius. It is located 278.52 light years away from the solar system.

HD 80869 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 80869 system


HD 80869 b

HD 80869 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2021-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.88 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 80869 b is 1545.480 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 80869 b is 12.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 80869 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 80869, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 80869 - System With 1 Exoplanet
